data.prayer: Father, thank you that in your kindness you have made every believer in Dorado, Puerto Rico a priest, who can offer spiritual sacrifices to you through Jesus.
data.verse: Therefore I tell you that the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a people who will produce its fruit. He who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces, but he on whom it falls will be crushed.”

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Dorado, Puerto Rico
data.section_summary: What people or resources could you pray for in this photo?

data.prayer: Spirit, teach those feeling unsafe in Dorado, Puerto Rico that they can hide under your wings
data.verse: He will cover you with his feathers, and under his wings you will find refuge; his faithfulness will be your shield and rampart.

data.prayer: Lord, make the 11,770 believers in Dorado to be brave and clear with the gospel to their 24,430 neighbors.
data.verse: So Paul and Barnabas spent considerable time there, speaking boldly for the Lord, who confirmed the message of his grace by enabling them to perform signs and wonders.

data.prayer: Father, bring yourself glory in Dorado. Through your servants plant 7 new churches that love you, love one another, and make disciples this year.
data.verse: For the earth will be filled with the knowledge of the glory of the LORD as the waters cover the sea.

data.focus_label: Pray for the city of Dorado
data.prayer: Pray that God raises up new churches in the city of Dorado, Dorado, Puerto Rico.
Over 5.45 percent of the people of Dorado are far from Jesus.
Spirit, guide the 11,770 believers in the state of Dorado into all truth as they interpret Scriptures.
data.verse: For the word of God is alive and active. Sharper than any double-edged sword, it penetrates even to dividing soul and spirit, joints and marrow;

data.prayer: Spirit, help every believer in Dorado, Puerto Rico be prepared to give an answer to everyone who asks them for the reason for their hope.
data.verse: But in your hearts revere Christ as Lord. Always be prepared to give an answer to everyone who asks you to give the reason for the hope that you have. But do this with gentleness and respect.
